refnamediv.refpurpose: min Selects the minimum value for the specified attribute, optionally over one or more dimensions.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The min operator selects the minimum value from an array attribute. For the corresponding aggregate, see the min aggregate reference.

refsect1.title: Inputs
refsect1.para:
The min operator takes the following arguments:
array: a source array with one or more attributes and one or more dimensions.
attribute: an optional attribute. If no attribute is provided, the first attribute in the source array is used.
dimension_n: An optional list of dimensions to group by.

informalexample.para: This example finds the minimum value of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para:
Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0];

Select the minimum value of each row of m3x3:
AFL% min(m3x3,val,i); [(12),(9),(5)]

informalexample.para:
Continuing on with this example, we can retrieve the minimum
      value, along with its position in the array, by using the following
      query:
AFL% project(filter(deldim(cross_join(aggregate(m3x3,min(val) as m),m3x3)),val=m),val);

step.para:
Find the minimum value, and alias it so that we can use it in a cross join:
AFL% aggregate(m3x3,min(val) as m) {i} m {0} 5

Cross join the minimum value with the original array, so that cell {i,j}x becomes {i,i,j}(m=min,x):
AFL% cross_join(aggregate(m3x3,min(val) as m),m3x3) {i,i,j} m,val {0,0,0} 5,20 {0,0,1} 5,12 {0,0,2} 5,17 {0,1,0} 5,15 {0,1,1} 5,9 {0,1,2} 5,11 {0,2,0} 5,11 {0,2,1} 5,5 {0,2,2} 5,16

Remove the extra dimension added in the previous step:
AFL% deldim(cross_join(aggregate(m3x3,min(val) as m),m3x3)) {i,j} m,val {0,0} 5,20 {0,1} 5,12 {0,2} 5,17 {1,0} 5,15 {1,1} 5,9 {1,2} 5,11 {2,0} 5,11 {2,1} 5,5 {2,2} 5,16

Filter (select) the cells that have the actual minimum value:
AFL% filter(deldim(cross_join(aggregate(m3x3,min(val) as m),m3x3)), val=m); [ [(),(),()], [(),(),()], [(),(5,5),()] ]

Of the correct cells, show only val, not the alias, m:
AFL% project(filter(deldim(cross_join(aggregate(m3x3,min(val) as m),m3x3)), val=m),val); [ [(),(),()], [(),(),()], [(),(5),()] ]
